newsitem.title: CHINA: China's longest gas pipeline nears completion.
newsitem.headline: China's longest gas pipeline nears completion.

text.p: A key section of China's longest gas pipeline project running through the northern provinces of Shaanxi, Shanxi, Hebei and Beijing municipality has been completed, the Xinhua news agency said on Thursday.

The 3.3 billion yuan pipeline project starts at Jingbian county in Shaanxi province and ending in western Beijing, it quoted Yang Chengzhi, a senior official of the China National Petroleum Corp, as saying
The key part of the project runs for 150 km and when the whole pipeline is completed next September it will supply gas to Beijing and the neighbouring port city of Tianjin, Yang said.
Upon completion, the pipeline will have an annual supply capacity of 1.1 billion cubic metres in the first several years and this will be expanded to 2.0 billion cubic metres.
The gas pipeline will help to make up for power shortages in Beijing and Tianjin, hit by serious pollution from heavy consumption of coal, Yang said.
